title: Saving IDA graphs as image
content:
How Can I save IDA Pro's normal graph view as image?
Is there any tool or plugin for that?

comments.text: Which graphs? Proximity view? Normal graph view? Old graph view?

how about using PySide (PySide 2011/12/30 for IDAPython 1.5+, Python 2.7 (2.6) and Qt 4.8.4 (IDA 6.5)) from the download section on the Hex-Rays page and then asking in a developer Q&A (or forum) for the details about the Qt part?
You can also take a screenshot ;)
I think graph-easy is limited to Linux. I just tried installing to windows but haven't managed it.

answers_data.content:
You can save the graph as a .gdl file. You can then use graph-easy to convert the GDL file to an image file such as SVG, PNG, JPG etc.

```
graph-easy --from gdl --input=graph.gdl --png --output=graph.png

```
